name: tetchily
content:

in a way that shows you get angry or annoyed easily: He tetchily dismissed the claim. See
tetchy
More examplesFewer examples She rang down to the reception, and asked tetchily whether she had been given the correct room number.Tetchily, the Duke ordered that Grant be protected.He was a militant antismoker, sighing tetchily and throwing open the windows when visitors lit up, even when it was snowing outside. "Oh never mind," he said tetchily as no one in the audience responded to his dig. "Give me a break," he responded, tetchily.
